meanings.definition: A green rust or patina formed on copper or brass.
meanings.sent1: The aerugo on the old copper statue gave it a unique look.
meanings.sent2: The aerugo on the roof of the building showed its age.
meanings.sent3: The aerugo on the penny made it look like a tiny piece of art.
meanings.sent4: The aerugo on the metal surface whispered tales of time passing by.
meanings.sent5: The aerugo on the antique vase sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To become or cause to become covered with a green rust or patina.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the metal outside will aerugo it over time.
meanings.sent2: The neglected garden tools began to aerugo from exposure to the elements.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally let the sauce aerugo while preparing other ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned car started to aerugo in the overgrown field.
meanings.sent5: The damp climate can quickly aerugo metal surfaces if not properly maintained.
